channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large cardboard boxes dumped on Burrage Road - The Oaks corner, 6th February
item.description:
Photo taken 5th February 2026 but still there on the 6th

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burrage Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish accumulated in kerbs and on pavement., 6th February
item.description:
Although small this is a busy street with a school and park at the end. . The kerbs and pavement are littered with disguarded snack wrappers & dropped recycling. There is no road sweeping activity of late and since the recycling centre is now appointment only, fly tipping is an issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seward Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martens Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping at side of Forest Lodge, Dartmouth Road, SE23 3Hy, 6th February
item.description:
Bamboo fencing, clothes dryer rack, shattered glass from a shower screen, large amounts of cardboard have been left at the side of Forest Lodge, next to the recycling bins. This rubbish has been there for over six months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Req to remove bollard o/s 21 Woolwich Rd, B'Heath, 6th February
item.description:
Req to remove bollard o/s 21 Woolwich Rd, B'Heath. Caller is thinking about buying the property but wants to know if the bollard on the f/way can be removed so that she can park her car outside. Can someone please contact the lady and advise.

item.title: Dead cat, 6th February
item.description:
There is a dead cat on the pavement. It looks like it has been hit by a car maybe? I walked past at about 9am. It wasn’t there yesterday evening. I didn’t take a picture because it was sad :(
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westcombe Park Road, Blackheath

item.title: Bike with huge advertising box chained on the Crescent, 6th February
item.description:
A bike with a huge advertising box on the back has been left on pavement which is blocking the footpath. People are being forced to walk in the road as they can not get by it. Please can this be looked into with a matter of urgency. There are a lot of elderly people, wheel chair users and is close to a park where children play.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area SATURATED with mud, 6th February
item.description:
The area located in the recreation ground next to Longlands school playing field is absolutely saturated with mud. Not only is it extremely dirty, but it is also very wet and slippery. The whole foot path leading from Appledore down to the playing field has been overtaken with mud which needs scraping back and clearing but the focus is the area where the barriers are at the junction of the field and the side road. It really is a mud pit.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Recreation Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Delivery vans regularly park across my drive the tarmac on my drip drive has now started to crack and we’re there is no post on the green it has ruined the grass and mad a mud bath when weather is bad which impact my path and driveway., 6th February
item.description:
The wholes on my driveway have been there since summer time and are now just getting worse, especially as delivery vans pull across the grass verge and onto my drive. So my drive is now ruined and being impacted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding, 6th February
item.description:
Resident called to advise her garden and footway is flooding, She believes this is build up from the stream. Please can we inspect and advise caller.
